revised_title: A Reassessment of Taylor's Electrohydrodynamic Theory
tldr: This article reexamines Taylor's electrohydrodynamic theory, focusing on the induced motion and deformation of a conducting drop suspended in another conducting fluid under an electric field. By satisfying the boundary conditions more accurately, the authors find an increase in drop deformation, which partially explains the discrepancy between theory and experiment. However, the smallness of an expansion parameter limits the reduction of this discrepancy.
